asia_mong037.investigators: Pederson, N.; Saladyga, T.; Suran, B.; McGraw, K.; Aria, U.; Nachin, B.
asia_mong037.reference: Authors: listed above on deep deposit of sandy soil south-southeast of the town Sukhbaatar, Mongolia for the potential usage in a reconstruction of hydroclimate. The trees cored here were somewhat open grown at the time of sampling. However, much of the low density is likely due to an intense fire in the years prior to our sampling. There ihttps://nesdev.ncdc.noaa.gov/i/asfdcldr.gifs much evidence of fire in this landscape. Use with care. For example, detrending these series mostly requires detrending as would be performed of trees from forest interior or closed-canopy forests. There appears to be periods of suppression and release from several trees when they were young. Fire damage is also a likely contributor to ring width variation. asia_mong034.reference: Authors: listed above on two parallel ridges in the western portion of the Khenti Mountains in Mongolia for the potential usage in a reconstruction of hydroclimate. The forest in which these trees were cored is low density given the steep slopes and proximity of bedrock to the soil surface. The forest, however, is not a classically open-grown forest from which many dendroclimatic collections are made. Also, a fire within the previous 2-5 years scorched some portions of this forest. Many of the trees making up this collection, however, are not from the most heavily burned stands. NOAA Template Raw Measurements file added 2019-04-08.
